item.title: 得克萨斯州洪灾造成至少 13 人死亡；夏令营儿童失踪
item.description: 在得克萨斯州发生的灾难性洪灾已造成至少 13 人死亡，数十人失踪，官员们警告说，未来几天将有更多降雨，并有可能发生更多山洪。【原文：At least 13 people have died and dozens are missing after catastrophic flooding in Texas, with officials warning of more rain and the risk of further flash floods in the coming days.】

item.title: 洪灾过后，得克萨斯州夏令营有 20 多名女孩失踪
item.description: 周五，洪水肆虐德克萨斯州中南部地区，一个女子夏令营的 20 多名营员下落不明，德克萨斯州的父母们疯狂地在社交媒体上发布小女儿的照片，并请求提供相关信息。【原文：Texas parents frantically posted photos of their young daughters on social media with pleas for information as more than 20 campers from an all-girls summer camp were unaccounted for Friday after floods tore through the state's south-central region.】

item.title: 声明草案显示金砖国家将谴责 "胁迫性 "关税
item.description: 金砖国家领导人准备在贸易关税、中东冲突和应对气候变化的必要性等问题上采取与美国总统唐纳德-特朗普相左的立场。【原文：BRICS leaders are poised to adopt a position at odds with US President Donald Trump on trade tariffs, aspects of conflict in the Middle East and the need to tackle climate change.】

item.title: 破坏者和维护失误导致约翰内斯堡大片地区干涸
item.description: 自上月下旬以来，南非最大城市约翰内斯堡的大部分地区一直处于停水状态，原因是水库正在努力从定期维护中恢复过来，而且犯罪分子还破坏了一条重要的输水管道。【原文：Large parts of Johannesburg, South Africa’s biggest city, have been without water since late last month as reservoirs struggle to recover from scheduled maintenance and after criminals vandalized a key pipeline.】

item.title: 美国退出，最大气候基金批准创纪录拨款
item.description: 世界上最大的气候基金表示，在美国撤回向该组织承诺的 40 亿美元的一年里，该基金批准了创纪录的项目拨款。【原文：The world’s biggest climate fund said it approved record allocations for projects in a year when the US pulled $4 billion it had pledged to the organization.】

item.title: 热浪袭击欧洲，德国高速公路出现裂缝
item.description: 德国将于本周末对其高速公路进行紧急维修，因为最近几天的极端高温天气炸毁了高速公路主要路段的大块混凝土。【原文：Germany will carry out emergency repairs on its autobahn this weekend after extreme heat in recent days blew up large chunks of concrete along key stretches of the highway.】

item.title: 酷热天气东移，希腊和土耳其被炙热高温灼伤
item.description: 周五，强烈的热浪继续炙烤着欧洲，消防员们争分夺秒地控制着希腊和邻国土耳其的野火。【原文：An intense heat wave continued to scorch Europe on Friday as firefighters scrambled to control wildfires in Greece and neighboring Turkey.】

item.title: 日本 1.7 万亿美元基金增持 ESG 股票，其他基金纷纷出逃
item.description: 日本 1.7 万亿美元的政府养老金投资基金（Government Pension Investment Fund）增加了其环境、社会和公司治理（ESG）投资，拒绝许多全球资产管理公司放弃绿色战略的做法。【原文：Japan’s $1.7 trillion Government Pension Investment Fund has added to its ESG investments, rejecting the shift away from green strategies by many global asset managers.】

item.title: 欧洲央行警告热浪对通胀和经济增长的影响
item.description: 欧洲中央银行执行董事会成员弗兰克-埃尔德森认为，热量与通货膨胀和国内生产总值等关键经济指标之间的联系非常重要，不容忽视。【原文：The link between heat and key economic indicators such as inflation and gross domestic product is too important to ignore, according to European Central Bank Executive Board member Frank Elderson.】

item.title: 取消税收减免对电动汽车市场意味着什么？
item.description:
由于各州和经销商推出了一系列新车型和优惠措施，销量可能会低于预期，但不会完全跌至谷底。【原文：

Sales are likely to dip below forecasts but not completely bottom out thanks to an array of new models and incentives from states and dealers. 

】

item.title: 在加利福尼亚，支持住房 "富足 "的粉丝们改写了一个环境里程碑
item.description:
一些环保人士对州长加文-纽森（Gavin Newsom）取消住房和先进制造业反污染法律的举措表示赞赏。其他人则感到震惊。【原文：

Some environmentalists applaud Governor Gavin Newsom’s move to roll back anti-pollution laws for housing and advanced manufacturing. Others are horrified.

】

item.title: 金砖国家渴望占领美国在特朗普执政期间空出的全球阵地
item.description: 自十多年前金砖五国成立以来，这个新兴市场国家集团一直在努力寻找共同目标。唐纳德-特朗普总统的关税政策可能解决了这个问题。【原文：Ever since BRICS was founded more than a decade ago, the group of emerging-market nations has struggled to identify a common purpose. President Donald Trump’s tariffs may have solved that problem.】

item.title: 大多数公司已经感受到气候的热度
item.description:
摩根士丹利发布的最新报告显示，全球大多数公司都感受到了世界变暖带来的影响。【原文：

Morgan Stanley has published a new report showing most companies around the world are feeling the impacts of a warming world.

】

item.title: 中国吉利品牌携纯电动和混合动力 SUV 进入意大利市场
item.description: 亿万富翁李书福的吉利汽车控股公司将首次以其同名品牌进入意大利，这将扩大中国汽车制造商在欧洲的扩张。【原文：Billionaire Li Shufu’s Geely Automobile Holdings will enter Italy for the first time with its namesake brand, extending a push by Chinese carmakers to expand in Europe.】

item.title: 土耳其批准碳市场计划，将其作为零净排放目标的一部分
item.description: 土耳其批准了启动碳市场的计划，以帮助其在 2053 年前将温室气体排放量减少到净零。【原文：Turkey approved plans to launch a carbon market to help cut its greenhouse gas emissions to net zero by 2053.】

item.title: 食品公司尝试 "嵌入式 "应对气候变化
item.description: 今天的时事通讯将介绍什么是 "嵌入"，以及食品公司如何测试这一概念以减少间接排放。【原文：Today’s newsletter looks at what “insets” are and how food companies are testing the concept to reduce their indirect emissions.】

item.title: 系统向东南移动，欧洲酷热引发火灾
item.description: 周四，一股严重的热浪继续席卷欧洲，给公共服务带来压力，并引发了席卷欧洲大陆的野火。【原文：A severe heat wave continued to blanket Europe on Thursday, straining public services and sparking wildfires as it swept across the continent.】

item.title: 英国国有能源公司将如何花费 58 亿英镑？
item.description:
大英能源公司临时首席执行官丹-麦克格雷尔（Dan McGrail）解释了公司将如何分配预算。【原文：

Dan McGrail, interim chief executive officer of Great British Energy, explains how the company will allocate its budget.

】

item.title: 报告显示：中国引领金砖国家向太阳能发电转型
item.description: 据一份新报告称，中国庞大的清洁能源产业引领了金砖国家太阳能发电的蓬勃发展，该集团去年的太阳能发电量占全球发电量的一半以上。【原文：China’s vast clean-energy industry has spearheaded a BRICS solar-power boom, with the bloc accounting for more than half of global generation last year, according to a new report.】

item.title: 无人机正在清理布满垃圾的珠穆朗玛峰山坡
item.description:
在地球最高峰的一个登山营地，人们正在使用无人驾驶飞机清理垃圾。【原文：

High-flying unmanned aircraft are being used to whisk away garbage at one of the mountaineering camps on the highest peak on Earth.

】

item.title: 想要更便宜的太阳能电池板、家用电池或热泵？最好尽快行动
item.description:
参议院通过的特朗普税收法案将在12月31日后终止一些清洁能源税收抵免。房主和安装商都在争分夺秒地赶工期。【原文：

Trump’s tax bill passed by the Senate would end some clean energy tax credits after Dec. 31. Homeowners and installers are racing to meet the deadline. 

】

item.title: 据说 ADIA 和 CVC 是有意入股价值 120 亿美元的 Aggreko 的公司之一
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，阿布扎比投资局、收购公司 KKR & Co.和 CVC Capital Partners Plc 都在考虑收购全球最大的便携式发电机供应商之一 Aggreko 的少数股权。【原文：The Abu Dhabi Investment Authority, buyout firms KKR & Co. and CVC Capital Partners Plc are among parties considering buying a minority stake in Aggreko, one of the world’s biggest suppliers of portable power generators, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 巴克莱银行高级银行家直言气候融资的误区
item.description: 现在是时候从以气候融资为名犯下的错误中吸取教训了，因为越来越清楚的是，减排等旗舰问题疏远了当地社区，加剧了政治紧张局势。【原文：It’s time to learn from the mistakes made in the name of climate finance, as it becomes increasingly clear that flagship issues such as emissions reductions have alienated local communities and fueled political tensions.】

item.title: 由于火灾和海平面上升，加州已经没有安全的地方可以建房了
item.description:
与气候相关的风险阻碍了该州解决住房紧张的能力。这并非孤例。【原文：

Climate-related risks hamper the state’s ability to solve a housing crunch. It’s not alone.

】

item.title: 拉斯维加斯 "维尔加炸弹 "大风导致电力中断和航班延误
item.description: 周二晚些时候，一连串危险的暴风雨掀翻了拉斯维加斯的电线，数千人被困在黑暗中，能见度接近零的尘埃云迫使航班取消。【原文：A series of dangerous storms toppled power lines across Las Vegas late Tuesday, leaving thousands in the dark and forcing flight cancellations as a cloud of dust left visibility near zero.】

item.title: 摩根大通区块链部门探索将碳信用额度代币化
item.description: 摩根大通公司（JPMorgan Chase & Co.【原文：JPMorgan Chase & Co. is developing a new service to tokenize carbon credits and is partnering with a trio of carbon companies for an initial trial.】

item.title: 德国批准在海洋保护区钻探天然气
item.description: 德国为在北海一处受保护的海域钻探多达 130 亿立方米的天然气开了绿灯，这是德国为加强能源安全而采取的一项有争议的举措。【原文：Germany has given the green light for drilling as much as 13 billion cubic meters of natural gas at a protected marine site in the North Sea in a controversial step to bolster energy security.】

item.title: 欧盟将在碳边境税下为出口商提供保护
item.description: 欧盟正计划采取一项措施，在明年开始征收具有里程碑意义的碳边境税时，使其出口商免受过重的财政负担。【原文：The European Union is planning a measure to shield its exporters from disproportionate financial burdens when the bloc’s landmark carbon border levy kicks in next year.】

item.title: 欧洲热浪将有所缓解，但缓解可能只是短暂的
item.description: 周三，欧洲继续在强烈的热浪中炙烤，未来几天的降温可能只会带来短暂的缓解。【原文：Europe continued to bake in an intense heat wave Wednesday, and cooler conditions in the coming days may bring only short-lived relief.】

item.title: 中国太阳能玻璃制造商因减产报道扩大涨幅
item.description: 有报道称，由于需求减弱和供应过剩，太阳能电池板用玻璃生产商正计划在本月进一步减产，中国的太阳能电池板用玻璃生产商随即反弹。【原文：China’s producers of glass used in solar panels rallied following reports that manufacturers are planning deeper output cuts this month due to weakening demand and a surplus of supply.】
